data.title: Siim Kallas – Page 2 – POLITICO
data.meta_description: Latest news from POLITICO about Siim Kallas
data.text:
MEPs water down rail reform proposal

Technical areas to be agreed before April, but controversial subjects will be left for the next Parliament.

Estonian prime minister to step down

Andrus Ansip makes good on election promise to step down ahead of 2015 election, clearing way for bid by European commissioner Siim Kallas.

Kallas sets his sights on being prime minister

Siim Kallas, the European commissioner for transport, wants to step down before the end of his mandate to stand for prime minister in elections in 2015.

Fourth time lucky?

The EU is a long way from its goal of creating a single European rail market

Slow train coming

A lack of investment is holding back growth in the European rail sector

MEPs urged to support transport legislation

Supporters of the European Union’s attempts to make lorries safer say the opportunity should not be missed

London mayor attacks UK’s stance on lorries

Boris Johnson says rejecting mandatory EU design requirements will endanger cyclists.

Mobile devices allowed on EU flights

Commission confirms plan to allow the use of 3G and 4G signals on flights.

Commission cancels weekly meeting

Decision to drop meeting taken because too many commissioners were unable to attend.

Rule of law on the agenda

EU will attempt to re-energise relationship

Cabinet changes

Three European commissioners are changing their chiefs of staff this week. Margus Rahuoja (pictured), an Estonian, a long-time member of the private office of Siim Kallas, the …

The legacy of spending errors

Barroso administrations have failed to improve the execution of EU spending.

MEPs wary of ‘mega-lorry’ rules

Report opposes Commission’s plan for extra-large lorries crossing borders.

MEPs question Commission’s proposed pilot working time limits

Commission says the proposal would lower flight time limits in every member state.

Transport committee rejects EU pilot flight times

The proposal for harmonised EU standards will be put to the full European parliament in October

Court says rail firms must pay compensation for delays

Extreme weather conditions cannot exempt rail companies from compensation claims, ECJ rules.

Aviation emissions deal in doubt despite EU offer

EU will come under pressure at international talks.

Running on empty?

Europe’s quest for emissions-free transport faces many problems

Kallas criticises member state inaction on single sky

Siim Kallas, the European commissioner for transport, asks do member states still want to have a Single European Sky in the future?

Auditors call for end to EU transport financing programme

Marco Polo scheme should be scrapped, ECA says.

Eurotunnel accused of overcharging

Commission threatens France and the UK with court action; Germany warned over failure to ‘unbundle’ rail services.

The corridor of power

The European Parliament will hold a ceremony next Wednesday evening to name a corridor. It currently goes under the name of ASP 00F100, in the Parliament’s Brussels …

Unions vow to resist single sky proposal

Air traffic controllers on strike over new rules.

Job hunters

Itchy feet in the private offices of the European commissioners are getting itchier. With not much more than a year left in the life of Barroso II, …
